business.desc: Hills believes education should be driven by knowledge and curiosity, not anxiety or short-term goals. We help students build solid foundations, think independently, and prepare for the world’s top universities.

exam.title: Our View on Exams
exam.desc: Improving exam results means raising your true ability and achieving greater consistency. Real progress starts with deep understanding and genuine mastery, followed by targeted practice to build confidence and stability. At Hills, we focus on meaningful learning, not short-term cramming. We don’t trade on anxiety — we help students build lasting ability.

curriculum.title: Exclusive Course Design
curriculum.desc: Hills’ Foundation Programme is led by an all-Oxbridge tutor team, focused on academic depth rather than exam drilling. The course builds solid subject knowledge from A-level through to university foundation level, with extension to competition standard. Small-group, blackboard-based teaching develops clear logic, independent thinking and confident academic English — preparing students for success at the world’s top universities.

faculty.title: Top University Tutor Team
faculty.desc: Hills’ tutors are graduates of Oxford, Cambridge and other world-leading universities. With strong academic backgrounds and rich teaching experience, they understand what top universities look for and are dedicated to helping students build deep knowledge, sharp thinking skills, and stand out in their studies and applications.

success.title: Ideal Student Profile
success.desc:
At Hills, we believe that genuine interest in a subject is the most important admissions criterion. Only students who truly love their subject can keep exploring and achieving at university.
An ideal applicant shows: Passion for the subject，Strong understanding，Solid academic foundation，Quick insight.

aboutUs.subtitle: Elite Programs · Academic Excellence · Global Perspective
aboutUs.intro1: Hills Subject Foundation Course is an elite program distinct from traditional exam-oriented education, meticulously developed by a full team of Oxford and Cambridge mentors. We focus on teaching core subject knowledge, sparking academic interest, and cultivating students' independent thinking and exploratory abilities.
aboutUs.intro2: The course covers material from high school to university foundational levels and extends to competition-level difficulty, making it suitable for top university admissions assessments as well as international standardized exams.
aboutUs.intro:
In January 2015, I received a conditional offer from the University of Oxford. A parent of a younger pupil asked me for advice on applying to Oxbridge. I smiled and offered to guide them through the process. That year, we celebrated our very first Oxbridge offer — and so the story of Hills began.

Over the past ten years, I have never found teaching exhausting. Every time I see a student grasp something new or witness that spark in their eyes, I am reminded why I love teaching and feel fortunate to have this calling. Since then, we have supported hundreds of students in securing offers from Oxford, Cambridge and other top universities, while building a team of passionate educators who share this vision.

At Hills, we don’t trade on fear or offer empty “planning packages”. We believe the true purpose of education is:

To impart knowledge, nurture curiosity, and inspire independent thought.

Exams are not the be all and end all of education, and textbooks should never be treated as mere instruction manuals. No leading university wants its students to be exam machines.

We are committed to research-led teaching, developing our own accelerated programmes that focus on the heart of the subject. Our courses are not narrow and exam-focused--they equip students with comprehensive knowledge and skills to excel in all relevant assessments.

As Han Yu wrote over a thousand years ago: “A teacher is one who passes on the truth, imparts knowledge, and dispels doubt.” This is a belief shared by every member of the Hills team. We strive to continue the spirit of intellectual freedom passed down by the ancient Greek academies — where knowledge is shared freely, and the seeds of independent thought are sown.
aboutUs.oxbridgeTeamDesc: Our courses are delivered by experienced tutors who hold degrees from Oxford or Cambridge

aboutUs.wideApplyDesc: All courses are designed in-house with a focus on genuine understanding and long-term ability — not on exploiting exam insecurities
aboutUs.idealStudentDesc: This course is suitable for students in Grade 10 or equivalent international curricula who have a solid foundation in math and science, are eager to explore academic subjects in depth, and plan to apply to the world’s leading universities.

yu.name: Student Yu, Admitted to Engineering at the University of Cambridge
yu.intro1: Under long-term guidance from Mentor Kevin, the student set their sights on physics as early as Year 10, began self-studying university-level courses, and actively participated in research projects, building a solid academic foundation.
yu.intro2: During the preparation phase, they practiced systematically and enhanced their interview skills. Kevin provided not only abundant resources and university selection advice but also arranged one-on-one mock interviews with current students from target universities, helping the student perform confidently in formal settings.
yu.intro3: With passion for the subject, accumulated self-study, and comprehensive preparation, the student successfully received an offer from a top G5 university in the UK, realizing their dream of attending a world-class institution.

shi.name: Student Shi, Admitted to Engineering at the University of Cambridge
shi.intro1: In 2023, the student participated in the Hills Summer Camp and, through systematic coaching at Hills, successfully secured admission to the Engineering program at Cambridge.
shi.intro2: Through the Oxbridge summer program, exam preparation, and interview training, the student significantly improved their math and physics skills as well as their test performance.
shi.intro3: Their personal statement was refined with engineering reading extensions, accurately showcasing academic passion and professional potential.

xu.name: Student Xu, Admitted to Engineering at the University of Oxford
xu.intro1: Under Mentor Kevin’s guidance, the student built a solid academic foundation within one year and completed multiple mainstream competitions during the AS stage, gradually establishing academic strengths.
xu.intro2: By reading electrical and electronic engineering books and watching engineering videos recommended by the mentor, the student clarified their academic direction and systematically prepared for the PAT and ENGAA exams, completing all past papers to build a strong foundation.
xu.intro3: With Kevin’s connections, the student participated in multiple mock interviews with Oxford seniors, explored challenging questions deeply, and ultimately received an offer from the Engineering program at the University of Oxford.
